page.title: 12Dunton Village.
page.content: Dunton is built along part of the Biggleswade to Cambridge road. It is a linear village. The High Street hasfive cul-de-sacs leading from it, and down one of these (Church Street) is the only church. The church was built in 1499 and its organ was built in 1879. It holds many fund raising events for the restoration and repair of the church. The east windows were restored in 1959. The original windows had been destroyed during the Reformation. The local public house called The March Hare was originally called The Wheatsheaf and was one of five other public houses in the village. Today only one remains. In Chapel Street there was a chapel but it is now a builders yard.
